thread.title: Excited to play after a long gap, says Vijay
thread.title_full: Excited to play after a long gap, says Vijay - The Times of India

author: Sudheendra Tripathi
title: Excited to play after a long gap, says Vijay
text:
MUMBAI: He was the man in form with an 82 in the second Test against Sri Lanka, but a hamstring injury forced him out of the third Test at SSC in Colombo.
Frustrating it sure may have been to have missed out on an important game of the tour because of injury, but Murali Vijay is now back in action after missing the first two Ranji Trophy games. The Tamil Nadu opener will pad up for his team against hosts Mumbai in a Group B encounter at the Mumbai Cricket Association's Bandra Kurla facility from Thursday.
Having been out of competitive cricket for almost two months now, the 31-year-old was naturally enthusiastic about the game against Mumbai. "I'm pretty excited to play this game because it has been a long gap. After the Sri Lanka tour, I did not get any game at all. I am really working hard on my fitness. I'm looking forward for a positive result if I play all four days of this match and get some confidence going," he said after a training session on Tuesday.
